November 6, 1922
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You are familiar with the facts concerning the
death diagnosed as yellow fever which occurred on the
schooner “William E. Burnham” on September 13, which was
reported in a recent number of the United States Public
Health Reports. The schooner was en route from Sierra
Leone to Mobile via Paramaribo and Mungo, Dutch Guiana.

A letter received this morning from Doctor
White contains the following paragraph:

"The reports from Dutch Guiana about which I
took up telegraphic and telephonic communi-
cation with Washington cause me some uneasi-
ness, offer a very possible and very logical
explanation of Tampico and make me feel that
our investigation must not be delayed longer
than necessary.

“Will you not ask Carter's opinion regarding the
matter, while I get data as to vessels from
Guiana to Tampico.”

We shall be glad to have your judgment of this
case, and to transmit your opinion to Doctor White. Doctor
Doctor Carter
November 6, 1922
2
Long promised to send specimens of autopsy tissues if
they were obtainable, but has found out that they were
destroyed.
